attributes.action: offer free school meals based on income not the number of hours worked.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: At present free school meals are only available for children whose parent or parents work less than 16 hours a week.  This results in a situation where a parent working 15 hours a week earning up to £15,575 can claim free school meals, but a parent working more than 16 hours, with income including tax credits of less than £12,000, is unable to claim free school meals. Surely entitlement to free school meals should be based on income not the number of hours worked.
